pr_title: [homekit] add support for internal Valve timer

timeline.message:
add support for internal Valve timer

Signed-off-by: Eugen Freiter <freiter@gmx.de>

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't getSubscriber and getUnsubscriber be used here?
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Why not have ValveService be passed in as a parameter to the addRemainingDurationCharacteristic function instead of having to lookup and cast it here?
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
good one.
i will also move REFRESH to the caller method so that we have it once, after the timer is set or stopped.
replies.author: yfre

timeline.bodyText: I don't like that all this code is duplicated from getIntSupplier. Can you refactor it?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
yes, i had to add few lines to getIntSupplier. but indeed, it can be solved much better than copy-paste.
i will split getIntSupplier in 2 parts - getInt and getSupplier so that i can use getInt here and add  required lines.
replies.author: yfre

timeline.message:
incorporate feedback from cpmeister

Signed-off-by: Eugen Freiter <freiter@gmx.de>

update item state if default is used

Signed-off-by: Eugen Freiter <freiter@gmx.de>

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't you still need this since you removed it from stopTimer?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.author: yfre

replies.bodyText: Ah, didn't notice that. Looks good to me then.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Please cache item.getCharacteristicType() in a local variable for reuse.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: good one. need to pay more attention to this.
replies.author: yfre

timeline.message:
incorporate feedback from cpmeister

Signed-off-by: Eugen Freiter <freiter@gmx.de>
